property.propvalue: The location of the JDBC database.
property.propdesc:
For examples:
jdbc:mysql://databaseservername/databasename
jdbc:sqlserver://databaseservername;databaseName=databasename
jdbc:oracle:thin:@databaseservername:databasename
where databaseservername is the DNS host name (or IP) of the server hosting the database, and databasename is the name of a database on that server.

property.propvalue: The username credential required to access the database.
property.propdesc:
The user must have permission to search the directory for user-account information.
When connecting to an AD LDAP server running on Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 (or higher), enter a User account; do not use a Computer account.
